name: Makeney Hall Clarion Collection Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in late Feb to getaway for the weekend and to find a relaxed hideaway so she could finish writing her thesis. And this place delivered on all levels.
reviews.title: Luxury Hideaway

likes.liked: — The huge room with a great view

reviews.text: The superior room we'd booked, with a super view out to the village and fields below, was huge and felt more like an apartment than a room. The interiors have charm without being tacky and the Hall itself is a beautiful old building - you really feel like you've stepped back in time.
reviews.title: Good but could do better

reviews.text: Having said that, this place has all the mod cons including BTopenzone wifi which came in handy for us. You do have to pay a little extra for this however.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs

reviews.text: The food in the conservatory style restaurant was very very good (not extraodinary by any means) and we did have to ask for water a couple of times. Otherwise the service was spot on. There was a wedding on here whilst we stayed (which we thought might effect the service we got) but you'd never have known.
reviews.title: Getting Better

description: Makeney Hall Hotel is a magnificent Victorian country mansion, situated in the heart of Derbyshire, set in six acres of beautifully landscaped gardens with breathtaking views across the Amber Valley. Only eight miles from Derby and two miles from the flourishing market town of Belper, the hotel enjoys the most tranquil surroundings. The grandeur of the hotel setting combines with the warmth and attentiveness of our staff to make each guest feel at home and really special. From the informal Cocktail Bar to the elegant oak paneled dining room with an impressive oak fireplace, you’ll find daily and a la carte menus to tempt you wherever you prefer to dine. All of our 45 bedrooms are decorated in a warmly traditional style whilst the superior rooms have a period elegance this is in keeping the hotel’s heritage. With some of the most beautiful parts of the country on its doorstep, this hotel is also the perfect place for guests looking simply for a leisurely break in a truly hospitable environment. Picturesque grounds, impressive architecture and excellent cuisine make this hotel the perfect setting for a relaxing short break or other special occasions. As well as stunning scenery and marvelous walking trails, Derbyshire and the nearby Peak District are home to some of the country's finest stately homes including Chatsworth House, Haddon Hall and Kedleston Hall. For a family day out, enjoy a visit to Alton Towers or take in the delights of the local market towns of Bakewell, Buxton and Ashbourne. Makeney Hall offers Free WiFi Internet Access.
